column4: i use ntfs-3g very occasionally and haven't had a problem, although for safety, i'm in the process of backing up data on an ntfs drive ready to reformat to either fat32 or ext3 now i don't have any specific need to use windows
I found that since windows can read ext3, and linux can read ntfs, I never needed a 'middle' exchange partition
I installed an ext3 driver in windows - it doesn't have one as standard of course

i had a 320gb  drive in a windows server so needed t formatted as ntfs, i've replaced the machine with an ubuntu one now so don't need it as ntfs anymore, so for safety, im replacing it as a format natively read by linux
